required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Resistance Exercise, Muscle Mass, Strength and Body Composition
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Resistance Exercise on Muscle Mass, Strength, Body Composition and Heart in Men 30-50 Years Old.

brief_summary.textblock:
A plethora of trials reported the positive effect of resistance exercise on functional and morphological parameters. Although a large amount of the studies used suboptimum devices and obsolete methods the results of these older studies were still considered as golden standard. The aim of the present study is thus to determine the proper effect of different resistance exercise protocols with and without adjuvant protein supplementation on functional and morphological muscle and body composition parameters in male untrained subjects 30-50 years old under special regard of modern medical imaging and segmentation technologies.
Our general study hypothesis is that HIT-resistance exercise significantly impact relevant muscular parameters of the upper leg.

primary_outcome.measure: fat free Cross Sectional Area (CSA) upper leg
primary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline in fat free Cross Sectional Area at 5 months
primary_outcome.description: fat free muscle cross sectional area of the upper leg at mid-femur via Quantitative Computed Tomography (QCT)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline in CSA upper leg at 5 months
secondary_outcome.description: muscle cross sectional area of the upper leg at mid-femur via QCT

other_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline in intra-abdominal fat mass at 5 months
other_outcome.description: intra-abdominal fat mass via Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI)

other_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline in maximum strength leg press at 5 months
other_outcome.description: Maximum dynamic strength of the leg extensors/-flexors

other_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline in metabolic syndrome score at 5 months
other_outcome.description: Metabolic Syndrome Score according to Johnson et al.

other_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline in myocardial mass/enddiastolic volume at 5 months

arm_group.description: High Intensity Resistance Exercise Training, low repetition range, > 75% 1 Repetition Maximum (1RM)
High Intensity Resistance Exercise Training, high repetition range, 60 - <75% 1RM
High Intensity Resistance Exercise Training with protein supplementation

intervention.description: High Intensity Resistance Exercise Training, low repetition range, > 75% 1RM
High Intensity Resistance Exercise Training, high repetition range, 60 - < 75 1RM
High Intensity Resistance Exercise Training, low repetition range, > 75% 1RM and Protein Supplementation
control group, no intervention, maintenance of physical activity

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- males
- untrained (< 2 h exercise/week, < 1 h resistance exercise/week)
- 30-50 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- medication/diseases affecting intervention or study endpoints
- history of intense resistance exercise (> 3 h/week during the last decade)
- very low physical capacity (< 100 Watt at ergometry)
- more than 2 weeks of absence during the interventional period
- contraindication related to MRI-assessment (i.e. magnetizable intracorporal artefacts)
- pathological changes of the heart
- inflammable diseases

facility.name: Institute of Medical Physics, University of Erlangen-Nurnberg
